Summary Note:
The RM met Caroline Idun Kristensen during a business conference in Copenhagen. They attended several sessions together and realized they shared similar professional goals, leading to a fruitful partnership.
Caroline Idun Kristensen is a 64 year old retired CEO from Denmark.
She was drawn to Julius Baer's holistic financial planning and investment strategies, prompting the decision to join.
Family Background: Caroline Idun Kristensen is currently divorced. Her children are named Lykke and Petersen.
Education Background:
In 1980, Caroline finished her secondary school education at Roskilde Katedralskole.
Caroline completed her university studies at Aarhus University in 1984.
Occupation History:
Caroline Idun Kristensen is a seasoned professional with over 41 years of experience.
Caroline Idun Kristensen began her professional journey as a Hotel Manager at  Marriott International Danmark A/S in 1984, laying the foundation for future success.
After gaining experience, she took on the role of General Manager at Radisson Hotel Group Danmark A/S in 1991, further expanding her skill set.
At Scandic Hotels Danmark A/S, she worked as a Regional Vice President from 1992 to 1997, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
After 13 years of dedication, she assumed the role of CEO at  Marriott International Danmark A/S in 1997, spearheading high-profile projects and mentoring junior colleagues.
Wealth Summary:
During her work, she focused on financial growth, making diverse investments and ultimately saving 11630000 DKK.
She has villa located in Frederiksberg, worth 2090000 DKK.

She purchased flat in Odense, where she spends her holidays. It is valued at 1020000 DKK.
On top of that she inherited a beautiful villa in Aalborg, which could be used as a weekend getaway. It is valued at 2700000 DKK.
She does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: In summary, Caroline has demonstrated a strong work ethic and financial acumen, positioning them well for the future.
